summary: "Corpse Bride" is a 2005 stop-motion animated musical fantasy film directed by Mike Johnson and Tim Burton. Set in a Victorian-era village in England, the story follows Victor (voiced by Johnny Depp) who accidentally proposes to a corpse, Emily (voiced by Helena Bonham Carter). The film is inspired by a 17th-century Jewish folktale. Production started in 2003 and took place in London. It premiered at the Venice International Film Festival and was released in theaters in 2005. The movie was a hit with critics and audiences and was even nominated for an Academy Award for Best Animated Feature.
title: Corpse Bride
